--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "Kelli Traaseth"
<tktraas@p...> wrote:
<>Norma, if you don't mind, could I e-mail you off list too?<>

Kelli~:

This is precisely the type of question that I answer on my homeopathy
list. Sign in and ask away there. Others are welcome to join, too.
That way this list can stay on topic.

The Infinitessimal Dose
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Infinitessimal

Norma

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Another OT, homeopathy for pet allergies
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Norma  ** I am a ... Another OT, I see Norma is a homeopath and am wondering about others experiences with homeopathy. We
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Norma" <athomeopathy@...>

** I am a
> homeopath and**


Another OT,

I see Norma is a homeopath and am wondering about others experiences with
homeopathy.

We just got a dog. I love animals and so do the kids, but I have dog
allergies and my ds does too.

I know, stupid to get one, but we saw her at the human society's adopt
clinic and we were going to keep it outside, heated garage, blah, blah,
blah. Well, I/we couldn't keep her out there, she looked lonely, so
she's in the house now.

We love her to death, kids have been so happy with her. But my allergies
are kicking in and so are my ds and even dh's, I think, (we didn't know he
was allergic to dogs)

Any of you use homeopathic remedies for this, on a continual basis?


I picked up Animal Hair and Dander Refief from a Natural Food place. Seems
to kind-of work. Little scared to use it with my son, did give him a small
dose. There was some warning about asthma sufferers and he and I have a
touch of asthma.

Norma, if you don't mind, could I e-mail you off list too?

Kelli~





>
> Lots of experience with ankle and other injuries here. I am a
> homeopath and my daughter is a 16-year-old competitive figure
> skater. She falls dozens of times every day, at high speed, and
> hard. A month or so ago she dislocated her shoulder. Last week she
> had a huge swollen bruise on her thigh. It is always something in
> high level figure skating.
>
>
